page.title: 05Farming Continued.
page.content: Maesllwch Farm has a herd of 120 dairy cows.Each cow has a calf once a year. The calf stays with its mother for 3 days,then it is put on a milk machine. Each cow is milked twice a day for 305 days,then she is rested.The heifer calves are fed inside for 6 weeks on milk and then on solid foods.They are kept inside for 6 months then turned out to grass.The dairyman in charge works very hard from 4.30a.m.-5.00p.m. Maesllwch estate takes up 4km.squares of our area. {Travley.} This is a smaller farm of 150acres in the north of our region.It is a mixed farm of cows, sheep and chickens.Some of the land is kept for arable crops and swedes. Some of its fields are a mile away.The old barn still has some Wattle & Daub plaster and huge beams. It has been farmed for 100's of years.
